result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher E Ross was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
$3,435.00 payable first to Charity B.; $500.00 to Milwaukee County Burial Assistance; and $2,000.00 to Crime Victim Compensation.   Bail to be applied if applicable.
Restitution to be paid first and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges and supervision fees.
AS TO RESTITUTION/DNA surcharge/costs/surcharges:  To be paid through collectino by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

superMiscConds.notes:
No drugs or alcohol.
No contact with the victims or their family without prior Court/Agent approval. Any violation may result in additional charges.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that because he was convicted of a violent felony, under Section 941.29 he may not possess a firearm within five (5) years of completing sentence or he will be subject to a mandatory three (3) year Initial Confinement.
Concurrent with: Concurrent.  Credit for 130 days.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #2

Defendant Christopher E Ross in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Christopher E Ross in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.


Statements made as to sentencing.  Additional statements by: Tamika H., Charity B., and Shaveonte M. on behalf of the victim Latrail B. and victim D.J.

COUNT 1 - CONSECUTIVE:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 35 YEARS, with credit for 130 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 25 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

COUNT 2 - CONSECUTIVE;
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 15 YEARS, the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 10 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

COUNT 3 - CONCURRENT:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS, with credit for 130 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* No contact with the victims or their family without prior court/agent approval.  Any violation may result in additional charges.	
* Restitution payable to Charity B. for $3,435.00 (payable first), Milwaukee County Burial Assistance for $500.00 and Crime Victim Compensation for $2,000.00 or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  The Court also advised the defendant that because he was convicted of a violent felony under Section 941.29 he may not possess a firearm within 5 years of completing sentence or he will be subject to a mandatory 3 year initial confinement.

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, defendant Christopher E Ross not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 6.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher E Ross in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Defendant Christopher E Ross in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  State takes no position.  Status conference scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION FOR LEAVE TO WITHDRAW AS COUNSEL, received and filed. lms

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Christopher E Ross in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Defendant Christopher E Ross in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS. 

P.M.
At the hour of 1:35PM the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY as to all counts which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted State's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied Defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 6.  Court ordered a presentence investigation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher E Ross in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Defendant Christopher E Ross in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

AM
Jury in box.  
Court continues with substantive closing instructions on the law.
Closing arguments by state and defense.  State's rebuttal arguments.  Additional closing instructions.
Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 10:47 am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff Deputy Sarah Arredonda and Steve Sanfilipo who was duly sworn for that purpose.

Defendant Christopher E Ross in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Defendant Christopher E Ross in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

PM.
Defense request Court not count the defendant's adjudicated cases as part of his relevant conviction.  State objeccts.  Defense request is denied.

Court reopens State's case.  Court read stipulation in open court.  
Trial resumes.  Sworn for defense:  Defendant Christopher Ross on direct examination.  Cross examination.  Sidebar.  Exhibit 192 is marked.  Sidebar.

Jury out of box.
Sidebars are placed on the record.  Exhibit 192 is not admitted, but used for impeachment.
Court took a brief break to finalize closing instructions.

Jury in box.
Court read stipulation in open court.  Defense rest.  State has no rebuttal evidence.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.
Closing instructions on the law.

Jury out of box.

State rest subject to rebuttal.

Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily agreed to testify.

Court recessed for lunch.  Trial to resume at 1:15pm.  Jury trial scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Off the record conference held between the Court and counsels regarding issue with witness.  Trial resumed.  Recap of said conference set forth on the record by the state.  Statement made by defense.  Appearance made by Attorney Robert Webb (counsel for witness Maurice N-F.).  Statement made by Attorney Webb.  Statement made by Milwaukee Police Detective Keith Kopcha.  Sworn and examined by the state and defense:  citizen witness Maurice N-F.  Defense renews motion to adjourn and makes motion for mistrial.  Argument made by defense, followed by the state as to motion for mistrial.  Court in recess pending decision.  Trial resumed.  Court denies defense motions for reasons set forth; trial to continue.

Jury in at 2:59 p.m.  Sworn for the state: Police Officer Jeremy Carter (City of Milwaukee), citizen witness Brad B., Detective Marlon Davis (City of Milwaukee).  Exhibits offered by the state and received into evidence: 13, 14, 15 and 16 (published), 67, 2-4, 99, 5, 11, 12, 17, 18, 19, 6, 20, 22, 23, 100-105, 25, 26, 27, 29, 30, 31, 32, 106, 107, 92, 93, 97, 98, 122, 33-39, 46, 47, 48, 50-52, 54, 55, 66, 45, 58, 65, 72-79, 68, 69, 80, 83-85, 16, 40, 41, 42, 87, 88, 89, 90, and 94-96.  

Sworn for the state:  Detective James Hensley (City of Milwaukee).  Exhibits offered by the state and received into evidence: 123-128.  

Jury released for the day at 4:48 p.m. and instructed to return at 10:00 a.m.  Sidebar set forth on the record.  Court in recess for the day.  Case set for continuation of Jury Trial on 1-06-16 at 10:00 a.m. before Branch 06.

Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 3:08pm.   Strike for cause done on the record out of presence of the jury panel. Defense has received the CAD report and has discovered additional evidence also provided by client and is requesting an adjournment.  State objects to defense request and places reasons on the record.  Court DENIES defense request.  Defendant submitted a letter to the court.

CASE PASSED to allow parties to review the letter.

CASE RECALLED.
Parties had off the record discussions.  Defendant stated an alibi witness in the letter submitted.  State previously submitted a report regarding the investigation into the alibi witness.  Defense is seeking an adjournment.  Request denied.

Case to proceed to trial.  Court ordered a panel.
